issues.description: Method parameter mismatch for PersonService.getAllPersons: The problem statement (Part 3) and the template repository expect a getAllPersons method that accepts a single PersonSortingOptions parameter. The solution repository, however, changed the service signature to getAllPersons(PersonSortingOptions sortingOptions, boolean includeInactive) and updated PersonResource to call it with two arguments. This diverges from the template and the exercise description and will confuse students comparing the solution to the starter code (different method signature) or when trying to follow the instructions to implement sorting only. Students may implement the single-parameter version (as instructed) and then find the solution uses a different signature, or they may be unsure whether to add the additional boolean parameter themselves.
issues.suggested_fix:
Keep the method signature consistent across artifacts. Two options:

1) Preferred (align to problem/template): Change the solution repository to use the single-parameter signature public List<Person> getAllPersons(PersonSortingOptions sortingOptions) and update PersonResource to call personService.getAllPersons(new PersonSortingOptions(sortingOrder, sortField)). Implement the sorting logic inside that single-parameter method (as described in the problem).

2) Alternatively (if includeInactive is required): Update the problem statement and the template to document the additional boolean parameter (includeInactive), and change the template's PersonService signature to public List<Person> getAllPersons(PersonSortingOptions sortingOptions, boolean includeInactive) so all artifacts match the solution. Ensure the exercise text explains the purpose of the boolean parameter and any default behavior.

issues.description: The problem statement and template expect PersonService.getAllPersons(PersonSortingOptions) (no extra parameters) as the API to implement sorting (Part 3). The solution, however, changes the service API to getAllPersons(PersonSortingOptions, boolean includeInactive) and has PersonResource call personService.getAllPersons(..., true). This signature change is inconsistent with the template/problem instruction (which even warns not to change PersonService attributes) and will confuse students: they will implement and test against the original single-parameter method but the solution uses an additional boolean parameter (or vice versa). The mismatch makes mapping the problem requirement to the provided/template API unclear and can cause compilation/test failures or extra, unnecessary cognitive load.
issues.suggested_fix: Restore a single-parameter API that matches the problem/template: provide public List<Person> getAllPersons(PersonSortingOptions sortingOptions) in PersonService. If the additional includeInactive behavior is desired, add an overloaded helper (e.g. getAllPersons(PersonSortingOptions sortingOptions, boolean includeInactive)) but keep the original single-parameter method and make it delegate to the two-parameter version (e.g. return getAllPersons(sortingOptions, true)). Also update PersonResource to call the single-parameter method (personService.getAllPersons(new PersonSortingOptions(sortingOrder, sortField))) so the template, problem statement, and solution are aligned.
